Name_5: Procter & Gamble exiting namesake Toronto office building
Text_5:
What The consumer goods company is leaving 4711 Yonge Street

The consumer goods company is leaving 4711 Yonge Street Why The 90000 sq ft block is available in February 2025

The 90000 sq ft block is available in February 2025 What next CBRE has the marketing assignment

Procter & Gamble is vacating its namesake Toronto office building.

The consumer goods company is downsizing from its 90000 sq ft office at 4711 Yonge Street. CBRE is marketing the concourse ground floor and second floor block at the Yonge and Sheppard tower which is owned by Menkes. P&G declined to comment on its move.

While pricing for the P&G office space was not available the asking net rent for the 15th floor is $21/sq ft on par with the average for the North Yonge submarket. Additional rent for the 23000 sq ft space is $23.61/sq ft. Suite 902 at 17000 sq ft asks the same.

As of the end of Q1 the office vacancy rate in the North York submarket was 24.7% higher than the Toronto North average of 19.3%.

The P&G block is available as of Feb 1 2025 and podium signage is offered. The space is being marketed towards life sciences companies and data centre operators. It offers 25 watts of power per sq ft.

The 16-storey Class-A office tower was built in 1987. It’s LEED platinum certified and has seven elevators car-charging stations and a café.

One underground unreserved parking space is available per 1000 rentable sq ft. Highway 401 and six GO Bus routes are nearby and there is direct underground access to the Yonge-Shephard subway station.

Procter & Gamble owns home health and personal care brands including Tide Gilette and Pantene. Geraldine Huse is the president of P&G Canada.

Name: Progressive Corporation
Name_1: A Democratic socialist the state's most liberal lawmaker: Meet the Texas progressives aiming for Congress
Text_1: ERROR: Article `download()` failed with 403 Client Error: Forbidden for url: https://www.expressnews.com/news/legislature/article/A-Democratic-socialist-the-state-s-most-16707865.php on URL https://news.google.com/articles/CBMiaWh0dHBzOi8vd3d3LmV4cHJlc3NuZXdzLmNvbS9uZXdzL2xlZ2lzbGF0dXJlL2FydGljbGUvQS1EZW1vY3JhdGljLXNvY2lhbGlzdC10aGUtc3RhdGUtcy1tb3N0LTE2NzA3ODY1LnBocNIBAA?hl=en-US&gl=US&ceid=US%3Aen
Name_2: Woke capitalism is a smokescreen
Text_2:
A billboard in London recently featured a bizarre advertisement for the multinational bank HSBC. It depicted an androgynous person applying mascara and a bold message: “Gender’s just too fluid for borders.”

HSBC would seem to have no business interest in gender theory except that the bank too rejects borders. The bank lobbied aggressively against Brexit in 2016 and has protested the result ever since. The free flow of capital brooks no constraints.

Advertisement

The same goes for much of corporate behavior today. On this side of the pond major corporations have aligned themselves publicly with progressive political and social causes from LGBTQ+ pride and abortion rights to racial justice and climate change. American business long served as the archetypal bourgeois institution: meritocratic buttoned-up and reliably Republican.

Advertisement

But the U.S. Chamber of Commerce has since given up its old partisan loyalties and woke corporate titans preach a new golden rule. As Apple chief executive Tim Cook has said: “You don’t have to choose between doing well and doing good.” The pursuit of profit now follows the march for social justice.

Opinion Get smart opinions on the topics North Texans care about. SIGN UP Or with: Google Facebook By signing up you agree to our Terms of Service and Privacy Policy

Observers have struggled to make sense of these developments. But conservatives are justified in feeling betrayed just as progressives are right to be leery of their new corporate allies. Woke corporate activism as the HSBC example attests is primarily an attempt to launder self-interest through liberal ideology and to renege on actual obligations.

Woke corporate politicking takes many forms and American business has intervened in public debates in a variety of ways in recent years. The marketing has become commonplace pushing progressive political narratives under the pretext of advertising: Gillette condemns “toxic masculinity” the NFL declares that “football is gay” and so on.

Advertisement

Beyond this so-called brand activism corporate retribution has become a regular tactic in Republican-controlled states. Fortune 100 companies have used their market power to force the repeal of legislation threatening high-profile boycotts in states like Indiana North Carolina and Georgia.

Some corporate activism can plausibly be explained by a straightforward business logic. After all maintaining a progressive reputation can serve the bottom line. For knowledge-sector firms it can attract talent in the competitive labor market for high-skill (read: college-educated) workers. The retailer or consumer-product company may win over the emerging market of conscious consumers in the bid for brand loyalty. “Go Woke Go Broke” is a mere mantra not a law of business performance.

Nevertheless critics are swift to point to the hypocrisy. How can Nike elevate Colin Kaepernick as a woke spokesman for Uyghur-made shoes? How can Amazon create its own Paris Agreement for net-zero emissions while bowing to Chinese censors and exploiting a vulnerable workforce?

Advertisement

How can Starbucks chief executive Howard Schultz lecture employees about “building bridges not walls” for impoverished immigrants yet admonish workers attempting to organize to emulate the self-sacrificial struggle of Holocaust survivors?

Advertisement

The hypocrisy abounds but the hypocrisy is the point. Woke posturing can serve ulterior motives — not just marketing and recruiting but hedging against risks. In a period when business feels besieged from the left and the right performative wokeness may forestall political retribution.

A new initiative can function as a kind of PR sleight-of-hand to obscure malfeasance while a new corporate policy may serve as a peace offering to would-be regulators. Rather than a means of engaging in political activity woke capital may be a ploy to avoid being its subject.

What often distinguishes woke capitalism is how it employs quasi-governmental power to enforce its ideology. Nonprofit organizations track and publish corporation performance on a range of progressive social issues such as the Human Rights Campaign’s “Corporate Equality Index” on the promotion of LGBTQ+ rights.

Advertisement

Other organizations develop industry standards for corporate disclosure such as the Sustainability Accounting Standards Board’s (SASB) standards for environmental social and corporate governance reporting. (Though the Securities and Exchange Commission has not adopted SASB standards major institutional investors including BlackRock Vanguard and State Street now require them for portfolio companies.)

Often business institutions themselves develop and enforce rules promoting particular social agendas. For instance the NASDAQ stock exchange instituted a rule requiring a listed company to disclose the gender ethnicity and LGBTQ+ status for members of its board which shall have at least two “diverse” directors.

In perhaps the most telling example the Business Roundtable virtually codified “corporate social responsibility” dogma in August 2019 when it proposed to redefine the purpose of a corporation to encompass “a fundamental commitment to all of our stakeholders.”

Never mind that American law explicitly defines corporate obligations or that historically legislatures granted corporate charters for narrowly prescribed purposes; the statement co-signed by nearly 200 CEOs enumerated a particular set of responsibilities to customers employees suppliers business partners communities and shareholders.

Advertisement

Many critics decried the statement for abandoning the doctrine of shareholder primacy which prioritizes maximizing shareholder value over and above other considerations. But however symbolically the Business Roundtable statement may have displaced shareholder primacy with so-called stakeholder capitalism it did virtually nothing to change actual corporate behavior.

Nowhere did the statement list a particular set of measurable objectives much less establish means to uphold accountability. It merely spelled out business’s vaunted new purpose with the “commitment” to be responsible and uphold it.

And so even after two years the signatory companies had generally failed to incorporate new governance language that elevated the status of stakeholders and many opposed proposals to implement the statement’s vision claiming that the statement itself never required changes to their treatment of stakeholders

What was notable about the Business Roundtable statement aside from the widespread praise it garnered despite its vapidity is what it implied. That is major business leaders consider themselves to be unaccountable to others even as they claim responsibility for themselves.

Advertisement

Beyond the exercise’s farce there is a real tragedy here. American businesses have for decades acknowledged particular obligations to non-shareholders including workers customers and the broader public. The modern business practice of “stakeholder planning” has been around for more than a half a century and its purpose was practical not political: to help managers and executives understand how different business decisions affected different groups how to balance the often-conflicting interests that different groups might have.

But corporate politicking does little to meet these obligations. If anything it undermines them.

Consider workers. On the whole the new woke politics espoused in boardrooms and public brochures has little impact on them.

A recent American Compass survey of workers found that 59% of the American labor force would prefer its employer to focus on business and avoid taking public stances on social justice issues. Opposition to woke employers is strongest among those with the least education and only those with post-graduate degrees say that they’d prefer their employers to engage in social justice issues.

Advertisement

What woke capitalism demands is exactly what its messages dismiss or seek to avoid: constraint. We cannot expect businesses to constrain themselves. Instead we need institutional levers that check corporations’ worst impulses and hold them accountable to the obligations they have to workers and their families as well as the national interest and American public as a whole.

This can start with two groups where obligations are clearest and where direct accountability is more achievable: shareholders and workers.

To better hold woke corporations accountable to their shareholders policy reform could open new avenues for litigation. For instance shareholders could be granted the privilege to sue corporations for violating their fiduciary duty when they engage in political activities unrelated to their pecuniary interests.

Exposing public companies and their executives to litigation in this way could prove to be powerful countervailing force against the worst woke impulses. Sen. Marco Rubio’s Mind Your Own Business Act would create just this sort of legal constraint on public corporations and their executives on behalf of shareholders.

Advertisement

Other reforms could build structures within companies for workers to exercise their voice in the boardroom and hold executives accountable to their interests. For instance federal labor law could be reformed to enshrine the right to elect worker representatives on corporate boards. A few proposals already exist to establish a minimum requirement for worker representatives as a composition of boards. A more modest starting point may be to give workers the option to fill one or two board seats with their representatives.

Another approach to give workers representation within the boardroom would be to institute employee stock ownership plans or ESOPs. This is an employee benefit program that would acquire company stock and hold it on behalf of the employees thereby giving them an ownership interest in the company and depending on the scale of the ESOPs board representation as any other large shareholder.

Opposing woke capitalism shouldn’t become another form of political posturing from the bully pulpit merely the obverse of woke capital itself. The goal of any effort to rein in woke capitalism should be to build structures to serve as countervailing forces against woke capitalism’s impulses on behalf of workers.

Wells King is the research director at American Compass. He wrote this column for The Dallas Morning News.

Advertisement

Name_1: ICICI Pru first insurer to sign UNPRI on ESG issues
Text_1:
Hyderabad: In a journey towards promoting sustainability ICICI Prudential Life Insurance has become the first Indian insurance company to sign the United Nations-supported Principles for Responsible Investment (UNPRI) committing towards Environment Social and Governance (ESG) issues across its business activities.

Manish Kumar Chief Investment Officer of the company said "This reinforces our commitment towards integrating a responsible framework to promote ESG factors in our investment management decisions. Climate change is impacting lives and livelihoods around us and as one of the largest domestic financial institutions in the country it is incumbent on us to act proactively and responsibly on ESG factors to save the planet."

"As part of our commitment towards promoting sustainable investing we recently launched the 'Sustainable Equity Fund' an ESG-focused fund and in the process became the first life insurance Company in India to do so. Promoting sustainability is a natural extension of our vision of building an enduring institution which serves the protection and long-term saving needs of customers with sensitivity. We firmly believe that adopting the UNPRI will nudge corporations to enhance focus on ESG initiatives to build sustainable businesses which in-turn generate superior returns for all stakeholders" he added.

With over Rs 2.37 trillion of assets under management ICICI Prudential Life Insurance is a key institutional investor and believes integrating the ESG framework in its investment management practices will ensure sustainable value creation for all stakeholders. The Company also engages with investee companies on ESG issues to ensure the business operates in a responsible and sustainable manner benefiting the environment society and investors.

NATIONAL AFFAIRS

Union Cabinet gives nod to raise women’s marriage age to 21 from 18 years i.The Union Cabinet chaired by Prime Minister (PM) of India Narendra Modi has given its nod for proposal to bring uniformity in the marriageable age of men and women thereby increasing the legal age of marriage of women from 18 to 21 years.

ii.In this regard a Bill will be introduced to amend the Prohibition of Child Marriage Act (PCMA) 2006 Special Marriage Act 1954 and personal laws such as the Hindu Marriage Act 1955 in the ongoing winter session of Parliament (November 29- December 23 2021).

iii.The legal age to get married for men is 21.

iv.This decision will not only boost gender equity and gender empowerment but also enable girls to complete their college studies and start earning.

About Ministry of Women and Child Development (MWCD):

Union Minister– Smriti Zubin Irani (Constituency- Amethi Uttar Pradesh)

Minister of State (MoS)– Dr. Munjpara Mahendrabhai Kalubhai (Constituency- Surendranagar Gujarat)

HAL will be the Development-cum-Production Partner (DcPP) for supply of this target system along with private firms (50 percent of the volume).

DPIIT Launched LogiXtics Unified Logistics Interface Platform Hackathon

The Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT) under the Ministry of Commerce and Industry(MCI) has launched the Unified Logistics Interface Platform(ULIP) Hackathon – ‘LogiXtics’ with an aim to crowdsource ideas to benefit the logistics industry in India.

The hackathon was launched by Amitabh Kant CEO of NITI Aayog in the presence of Amrit Lal Meena CEO & MD of NICDC & Special Secretary Department of Logistics MCI and others.

LogiXtics is organised by (National Institution for Transforming India) NITI Aayog and Atal Innovation Mission(AIM) and supported by National Industrial Corridor Development Corporation (NICDC) and NICDC Logistics Data Bank Services Limited (NLDSL).

Aim: To promote the Startup community individuals or anyone with the strategic skills and domain knowledge of the sector.

LogiXtics Hackathon:

i.This Hackathon will provide a platform for the participants to showcase their strategic coding and domain skills on a national level to solve the existing logistics industry issues by

Ideating innovative ideas to bring transparency and visibility by automating optimizing and cross-utilizing India’s logistics resources/systems.

Developing solution/product by leveraging the logistics-related data available with various Government systems.

Contributing to India’s Ease of Doing Business and Logistics Performance Index (LPI).

ii.Hackathon is divided into 2 stages: the ideation stage & the prototype stage.

iii.The winner of the hackathon will receive a cash prize of Rs 10 Lakhs and the 1st and 2nd Runner-up will receive Rs 7 Lakhs and Rs 5 Lakhs respectively.

About ULIP:

i.ULIP is designed to increase efficiency and reduce logistics costs in India through a transparent platform that can provide real-time information to the stakeholders and remove all asymmetry information.

ii.ULIP is in line with the objective of PM Gati Shakti and is critical for achieving Aatma Nirbhar Bharat.

Cost of logistics in India:

i.Compared to developed countries like the United States(US) and Germany India incurs one of the highest logistics costs as a percentage of GDP.

ii.The cost of logistics in India is around 14% which is higher than in other countries in the world.

iii.Reduction of logistics cost to 9% will save up to USD 50 billion.

Central Government Grant ‘In-Principle’ Approval for 6 Nuclear Reactors at Jaitapur Maharashtra On 16th December 2021 Union Minister of State (Independent Charge) Science and Technology Dr. Jitendra granted ‘In-Principle’ approval for setting up 6 Nuclear Reactors at Jaitapur in Maharashtra.

The approval is for setting up 6 nuclear power reactors of 1650 MW each  making Jaitapur as India’s largest nuclear power generating site with a total capacity of 9900 MW

 making Jaitapur as India’s largest nuclear power generating site with a Technical cooperation is provided by the French Firm – Électricité de France (EDF).

Key Highlights:

i.The government provides strength to promote the use of nuclear energy in health services and agricultural programmes for indigenous development import substitutes for cost-effective treatment.

ii.The Bhabha Atomic Research Centre (BARC) is involved in the development pre-clinical evaluation and obtaining the radiopharmaceuticals committee’s approval for human use.

iii.Technologies for large-scale production of these radiopharmaceuticals are transferred to the Board of Radiation and Isotope Technology (BRIT).

About BRIT:

i.BRIT is involved in producing and supplying radiopharmaceutical products across India and also supports a large number of irradiators by supplying Cobalt-60 pencils.

ii.These irradiators are used for food grain preservation and sterilisation of medical products.

Note – Currently 6780 MW of Nuclear Power Capacity is established in India. The share of nuclear power in the total electricity generation in India is about 3.1 percent in the year 2020-2021.

About Bhabha Atomic Research Centre (BARC):

Director – Ajit kumar Mohanty

Headquarters – Mumbai Maharashtra

BANKING & FINANCE

CSB Bank Clear ties up to Launch ITR e-filing Facility for NRI customers On December 16 2021 Thrissur (Kerala) based Catholic Syrian Bank Limited (CSB Bank Limited) has tied up with Clear (formerly ClearTax) an online tax filing platform to launch an online and free of cost ITR (Income Tax Return) e-filing facility for its NRI (Non-Resident Indian) customers.

This collaboration will reduce customers’ efforts and time for tax filing.

This facility is also available to CSB Bank’s resident customers.

Key Points:

i.Through this partnership bank’s customers will also have an option for CA (Chartered Accountant) assisted ITR filing expert advisory on capital gains global income inheritance etc.

All these services will be provided at a discounted rate.

ii.Customers will also get free tax tools chatbot and call centre support for any queries related to self e-filing of income tax.

iii.The Managing Director & Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of CBS Bank is C. VR. Rajendran.

ICICI Prudential Life Insurance signs the UN’s Principles of Responsible Investing ICICI Prudential Life Insurance (IPRULIFE) became the first Indian insurance company to sign United Nations-supported Principles for Responsible Investment (UNPRI) to demonstrate commitment towards the environmental social and governance (ESG) issues.

Key Points:

i.In order to promote sustainability IPRULIFE is integrating ESG factors into its investment management framework.

ii.IPRULIFE has also recently launched the ‘Sustainable Equity Fund’ an ESG-focused fund to maintain sustainability.

About UNPRI:

i.The UNPRI is an investor initiative in partnership with the two bodies of the United Nations – the UN Environment Programme Finance Initiative and the UN Global Compact.

Goals – To understand and integrate the investment implications of environmental social and governance issues towards ownership decisions.

ii.Currently it has over 4000 signatories from 60 countries collectively representing over $120 trillion of assets committed to integrating ESG considerations into their investment practices and ownership policies.

About IPRULIFE:

i.IPRULIFE is a key institutional investor with Rs. 2.37 trillion assets and integrates the ESG framework.

ii.The sustainability framework is built on the three pillars of ESG namely leaving the planet a better place for the next generation giving back to society and transparency in functioning.

About ICICI Prudential Life Insurance Ltd:

It is promoted by ICICI Bank Limited & Prudential Corporation Holdings Limited

Operations Commenced on – 2001

Headquarters – Mumbai Maharashtra

CEO & MD – N. S. Kannan

Union Bank Partners with Home First Finance to Offer Home Loans Union Bank of India (UBI) has entered into a strategic co-lending partnership with Home First Finance Company India Ltd (HomeFirst) to offer home loans to customers at competitive interest rates.

HomeFirst will retain a minimum of 20 percent of the loan while 80 percent will be retained by UBI.

Aim – To provide a seamless experience to retail home loan customers in the priority sector and to strengthen both companies.

Key Highlights:

i.HomeFirst will originate loan amount according to UBI’s credit policy in accordance with Reserve Bank of India’s (RBI’s) Co-Lending Model

ii.The housing finance company will act as a servicing agent for the loan accounts throughout the loan period.

What is the Co-Lending Model (CLM)?

i.The framework of co-lending was provided by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) with an objective to join the low-cost funding model of a bank with cost-efficient sourcing and servicing capabilities of Non-Banking Financial Company (NBFC) to unserved and underserved sectors of India.

ii.The co-lending bank will take its share of the individual loans on a back-to-back basis in their books while NBFC is required to retain a minimum of 20% share of the individual loans on its books.

About Union Bank of India:

CEO & MD – Rajkiran Rai. G

Establishment – 1919

Headquarters – Mumbai Maharashtra

Chairman & Independent Director – Deepak Satwalekar

Established – 2010

Headquarters – Mumbai Maharashtra

Co-lending Partnership between Samunnati & IndusInd Bank to Support FPOs

India’s largest agri-tech enterprise Samunnati has entered into a co-lending agreement with IndusInd Bank to expand credit accessibility for Farmer Producer Organisations (FPOs) across India.

Under the co-lending agreement Rs 15 crore will be disbursed as an initial amount to farmer collectives.

Objective: To ensure the self-sustainability and profitability of Farmer Collectives and their members comprising mostly small-holder farmers.

To ensure the self-sustainability and profitability of Farmer Collectives and their members comprising mostly small-holder farmers. The partnership will enable easy access to working capital to Samunnati’s growing network of 1500 Farmer Collectives with a member base of 6 million farmers.

Co-Lending Model (CLM):

In November 2020 guidelines for co-lending between NBFC’s (Non Banking Finance Companies) and Banks was provided by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) and mandated NBFC’s to share a minimum of 20 percent of the credit risk by way of direct exposure on their books till maturity and the balance on the bank’s books. RBI Allows Payments Banks SFBs as Agency Bank to conduct Govt Business

On December 15 2021 in consultation with the Department of Financial Services (DFS) the Ministry of Finance Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has decided to make the Scheduled payments banks and scheduled small finance banks (SFBs) eligible to conduct Government (govt) agency business.

Key Points:

i.Background: On May 10 2021 RBI revised the existing guidelines on ‘Appointment of Scheduled Private Sector Banks as Agency Banks of RBI’ for authorising Scheduled Private Sector Banks as agency banks of RBI for conducting govt business (Central and/or State).

Note – In February 2021 the Finance Ministry had removed the embargo (an official ban) imposed in September 2012 on the allocation of govt business to private sector banks.

ii.All the instructions/conditions prescribed on May 10 2021 will henceforth be applicable to the scheduled payments banks and scheduled SFBs.

iii.Thus any payment bank or small finance bank which intends to undertake govt agency business could be appointed as an agent of RBI only upon execution of an agreement with RBI and also in compliance with the regulatory framework prescribed for those banks.

iv.If the Scheduled private sector banks (which is not having agency agreement with RBI) wish to undertake govt business it will be approved by RBI only if it is not under the Prompt Corrective Action (PCA) framework or moratorium of the RBI.

v.Concerned Central govt Departments /State govt has the sole option to accredit an agency bank and discontinue the bank from agency business.

About Reserve Bank of India (RBI):

i.The Reserve Bank of India was established on April 1 1935 in accordance with the provisions of the Reserve Bank of India Act 1934.

ii.The Central Office of the Reserve Bank was initially established in Calcutta but was permanently moved to Mumbai in 1937.

iii.Though originally privately owned since nationalization in 1949 the Reserve Bank is fully owned by the Government of India.

Innoterra & NABFOUNDATION signed MoU to Provide Services to 1 lakh Small Farmers On December 16 2021 Food and tech platform Innoterra signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with NABFOUNDATION to develop farmer clusters through its products and services.

NABFOUNDATION is a not-for-profit organization of the National Bank for Agricultural and Rural Development (NABARD).

The services will be provided in selected clusters over the next two years that will increase farm incomes over 3-5 years.

Signatories:

Sanjeev D Rohilla Chief Executive officer (CEO) NABFOUNDATION and Pablo Erat Chairman Innoterra

Key Points:

i.This partnership will enable over 5000 Farmer Producer Organizations (FPOs) and 1 Lakh smallholder farmers to access a host of services provided by the Innoterra platform.

ii.Innoterra platform provides 360-degree services encompassing farm inputs data-driven advisory traceability and market access to smallholder farmers in India.

About NABFOUNDATION:

It takes up scalable development projects of interest to National Bank for Agricultural and Rural Development (NABARD) and rural India.

Headquarters– Mumbai Maharashtra

PM Modi Becomes the 1st Foreigner to Receive ‘Ngadag Pel gi Khorlo’ Bhutan’s Highest Civilian Award On the occasion of Bhutan’s 114th National Day (17th December 2021) The Kingdom of Bhutan has honoured Narendra Modi Prime Minister(PM) of India with Bhutan’s highest civilian award Ngadag Pel gi Khorlo also known as Order of the Dragon King (Druk Gyalpo).

PM Modi becomes the first foreigner to receive the coveted award.

King Jigme Khesar Namgyel Wangchuck conferred the award upon PM Modi.

The announcement was made by Lotay Tshering Prime Minister of Bhutan.

Other International Civilian Honours Awarded to PM Modi:



Country Name of the Award Year Saudi Arabia Order of Abdulaziz Al Saud 2016 Afghanistan State Order of Ghazi Amir Amanullah Khan 2016 Palestine Grand Collar of the State of Palestine 2018 United Arab Emirates(UAE) Order of Zayed 2019 Russia Order of St. Andrew 2019 Maldives Order of the Distinguished Rule of Izzuddin 2019 Bahrain King Hamad Order of the Renaissance 2019 United States(US) Legion of Merit 2020

About the Ngadag Pel gi Khorlo:

The inaugural award was awarded to Her Majesty the Royal Grandmother Gyalyum Ashi Kesang Choden Wangchuck and 68th Je Khenpo Chab Je Thrizur Tenzin Dendup in 2008.

The Order of the Dragon King (Druk Gyalpo) was founded on 7 November 2008 by King Jigme Khesar Namgyel Wangchuck.The Druk Gyalpo is the official title of the head of state of Bhutan meaning Dragon King in Dzongkha.To recognise those who have devoted a lifetime of service to Bhutan and the people of Bhutan.First class and Second class.The award comes with a Breast Star and Sash Badge.

About National Day of Bhutan:

The National Day is annually observed across Bhutan on 17th December to commemorate the Coronation of His Majesty the First King of Bhutan Druk Gyalpo Ugyen Wangchuck on 17th December 1907.

17th December 2021 marks the observance of the 114th National Day.

About Bhutan:

Bhutan is officially known as the Kingdom of Bhutan.

APPOINTMENTS & RESIGNATIONS

Hyundai Motor Appointed Unsoo Kim as MD of HMIL

Hyundai Motor Company(HMC) has appointed Unsoo Kim as the Managing Director(MD) of Hyundai Motor India Limited (HMIL) starting from 1st January 2022. He will replace Seon Seob Kim (SS Kim) who will lead the Global Operations Division in Hyundai headquarters in Seoul South Korea.

HMIL a wholly-owned subsidiary of HMC is India’s first smart mobility solutions provider and the number one car exporter in India.

Union Minister Giriraj Singh launches MIS ‘Vikas Portal’ for rankings of States/UTs in Land Acquisition Projects On the lines of Central Government’s Gati Shakti Mission on December 16 2021 Union Minister Giriraj Singh Ministry of Rural Development (MoRD) launched MIS (Management Information System) portal namely ‘Vikas Portal’ for rankings of States/Union Territories (UTs) in Land Acquisition Projects under RFCTLARR Act 2013.

In this regard awards will be conferred upon top 3 States and top 3 districts by capturing the data figures and speed of the development in the country. It will promote healthy competition among States/UTs.

RFCTLARR is an acronym for Right to Fair Compensation and Transparency in Land Acquisition Rehabilitation and Resettlement.

Developers:

It is developed by the National Informatics Centre (NIC) team of Department of Land Resources (DoLR) MoRD with zero cost.

Key Points:

i.This portal will capture information on various parameters of land acquisition required for ranking of the State/UTs.

ii.It is a software-driven program under which respective State/UTs will submit relevant information for developmental projects on the basis of which ranking will be developed.

The ranking will be an automatic process with no interference of the department.

iii.The ranking will enable the states to monitor their progress as well as increase their speed of the developmental projects.

They will get marks out of 140 with a provision of negative marking for delaying implementation.

iv.In the first phase land acquisition is undertaken from January 1 2014 for ranking purposes and will be continued.

Other Participants:

Ministers of State (MoS) Faggan Singh Kulaste and Sadhvi Niranjan Jyoti MoRD; Secretary Ajay Tirkey (DoLR) among others

Shantanu Gupta authors Book on Yogi Adityanath – “The Monk Who Transformed Uttar Pradesh” The book titled “The Monk Who Transformed Uttar Pradesh: How Yogi Adityanath Changed UP Waala Bhaiya’ abuse to a Badge of Honour” authored by Shantanu Gupta and published by Garuda Prakashan was released in December 2021.

i.The book underlines the journey of Uttar Pradesh (UP) Chief Minister (CM) Yogi Adityanath from being born in Uttarakhand to becoming a Nath Panthi saint to CM of Uttar Pradesh.

ii.It also highlights the transformation of UP in various aspects like law and order connectivity education health infrastructure etc under the tenure of Yogi Adityanath.

iii.Yogi Adityanath was born on 5 June 1972 in Pauri Garhwal Uttrakhand. Currently he is serving as the CM of UP from BJP (Bharatiya Janata Party).

Other books by Shantanu Gupta

“The Monk Who Became Chief Minister” (2017).

In 2005 the International Committee on the Rights of Sex Workers in Europe adopted the red umbrella as its symbol for the rights of sex workers.

Tata Motors & Maharashtra Signed MoU to Set Up Vehicle Scrapping Facility

Tata Motors Limited one of India’s largest commercial vehicle manufacturers has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the state government of Maharashtra through the Industries Energy and Labour Department to support the establishment of a Registered Vehicle Scrapping Facility (RVSF) in Maharashtra.

The facility will have a capacity of recycling around 35000 vehicles a year.

Current Affairs Today (AffairsCloud Today)

Name: Public Service Enterprise Group
Name_1: Controversial Lake Elsinore hydroelectric project blocked by federal government
Text_1:
The Federal Energy Regulatory Commission has blocked a controversial $2 billion hydroelectric plant near the Lake Elsinore shoreline after the developer failed to provide requested environmental studies and a construction plan among other things.

Vista-based Nevada Hydro Co. has proposed building a 200-foot-high dam above the lake and a 500-megawatt underground power plant with turbines on 845 acres of U.S. Forest Service. Water would be pumped from the lake to a man-made reservoir when demand for electricity is low with water flowing back to the lake when demand is high. The project has been named the Lake Elsinore Advanced Pumped Storage Project or LEAPS.

This rendition from LEAPS developer Nevada Hydro purports to show a view of the Lake Elsinore Advance Pumped Storage Project from Lake Elsinore’s Eastern Shore.

An aerial view of Lake Elsinore looking south in 2005. Developer Nevada Hydro is proposing a hydroelectric project near the lake that would be called the Lake Elsinore Advanced Pumped Storage Project or LEAPS. (File photo by David Bauman The Press-Enterprise/SCNG)

A company is proposing to build a hydroelectric power project on Lake Elsinore’s west side seen in this photo.

The city of Lake Elsinore Riverside County the Pechanga Band of Luiseno Indians environmentalists and local residents oppose the project.

In a letter dated Dec. 9 FERC’s director of hydropower licensing Vince Yearick informed Nevada Hydro’s president that the commission was dismissing its project application because Nevada Hydro failed to provide the Forest Service with recreation groundwater seismic and geotechnical studies as well as a construction plan.

“The Forest Service states that while it has held multiple meetings with Nevada Hydro to seek resolution and completion of the required studies Nevada Hydro has informed the Forest Service that it does not intend to perform the studies and provide the remaining information prior to the Commission’s issuance of any license for the project” Yearick said in the letter.

Rejected again

On Dec. 13 the commission rejected Nevada Hydro’s Dec. 10 request for a preliminary permit that would give the company up to four years to conduct a project feasibility study. Nevada Hydro however could request a rehearing on the matter within 30 days said FERC spokeswoman Celeste Miller.

It was unclear what Nevada Hydro’s plans are moving forward. Company representatives including President Rexford Wait declined to comment.

New energy source

Nevada Hydro has also proposed installing 32 miles of transmission lines and 170 high-voltage steel towers that would carry electricity from Lake Elsinore to the unincorporated communities of La Cresta Tenaja Lakeland Village and Temescal Valley and then connect to power lines owned by Southern California Edison and San Diego Gas and Electric.

Nevada Hydro founded in 1997 said the project would give the region a reliable energy source and support 600 construction jobs and 20 to 30 permanent jobs. According to its website LEAPS was designed to respond to the growing need for reliable renewable electricity and to help meet California’s ambitious emissions reduction programs.

Welcome news

The federal government’s latest actions were welcome news to LEAPS opponents.

“Since this project is no longer formally in our program of work which serves to identify and prioritize current forest projects we will be able to shift our focus and put more energy into improving our recreational facilities and reducing hazardous fuels to reduce the risk to communities from catastrophic wildfire” said Freddie Duncan acting Trabuco District ranger of the Cleveland National Forest.

The Pechanga Band of Luiseno Indians spoke out against the project last year claiming Lake Elsinore as sacred tribal lands that were part of the Luiseno Creation Account and that events tied to the tribe’s religion and cosmology occurred there.

“We are pleased with this (project application) dismissal” Pechanga Chairman Mark Macarro said in a statement Friday Dec. 17. “There’s a reason Nevada Hydro has continuously failed to provide the necessary information for a thorough review: this is a hazardous incompatible and infeasible project for the wrong location. It’s time they move on.”

Problematic history

Nevada Hydro has been trying to get its LEAPS project off the ground for 17 years. It submitted its first application to the commission in February 2004. The history of the LEAPS project and the rocky relationship between Nevada Hydro and FERC dates back to 2004 and has gone back and forth with the commission ever since.

In 2011 FERC in another rejection letter to Nevada Hydro cited conflicts between the Elsinore Valley Municipal Water District and Nevada Hydro for denying its application. The commission also said Nevada Hydro and the commission had different goals had been unable to work together in the past and likely would be unable to collaborate if a license were issued.

Lake Elsinore reacts

On April 9 2019 the Lake Elsinore City Council unanimously voted to take a formal stance opposing the LEAPS project subject to conditions Deputy City Manager Nicole Dailey said in an email.

Among the community’s myriad concerns with the project are its potential adverse impacts on lake water quality lake levels the fishery and the shoreline. Other concerns Dailey said include the potential for disasters should the proposed dam breach fire hazards from the proposed 32-mile segment of high powered transmission lines the impact on wildlife the overall impact to the aesthetics of the community and the lake and the potential for property damage and acquisitions.

“The City Council has urged Nevada Hydro the project proponent to give serious consideration to these concerns and to provide additional project details including actual and measurable public benefits” Dailey said. “Unfortunately despite the passage of more than two years community concerns have not been addressed and the benefits of the project to the public remain elusive while the project impacts could be considerable.”

She said the commission acted appropriately in dismissing Nevada Hydro’s application.

“The U.S. Forest Service required Nevada Hydro to conduct additional studies in the Cleveland National Forest” Dailey said in an email. “Nevada Hydro refused to perform the studies and it appears from the dismissal gave the commission no choice but to dismiss the application based on their policy.”
Name_2: From Satya Nadella To Sundar Pichai: 11 Most Loved CEOs Of Large Tech Companies
Text_2:
Comparably -- an online portal that reveals company cultures and market compensation updated by actual employees has now shared a list of the best company CEOs (of large companies) as rated by their staff.



Comparably

Also Read: From Google To IBM: Indian Origin CEOs Who Are Running American Big Tech

And not so surprisingly the top 3 places have been awarded to Indian-origin CEOs. Let’s have a look at the top 11 tech company CEOs as ranked by their employees.



1: Shantanu Narayen - Adobe

The first on the list is the CEO for creative applications giant Adobe -- Shantanu Narayen. He took the reins of the company in December 2007.

Reuters

Born in Hyderabad he completed his bachelor's degree in electronics and communication engineering from University College of Engineering Osmania University in Hyderabad followed by a master's degree in computer science from Bowling Green State University in Ohio and an MBA from the Haas School of Business University of California Berkeley.



One of his employees describes him stating "Our CEO acts like an adult. He doesn't make a fool of himself on Twitter. And he makes an active effort to do good things for the global community."

2. Arvind Krishna (IBM)

Next on the list is the CEO of IBM Arvind Krishna. He was recently appointed as the CEO of the company in January 2020 and previously held the position of Senior Vice President looking after properties like IBM Cloud IBM Security and Cognitive Applications business as well as IBM Research.

IBM

Born in Andhra Pradesh he completed his undergrad from IIT Kanpur and later a PhD from the University Of Illinois at Urbana Champaign. He has also been awarded the prestigious Alumni awards from the institution. He has also co-authored 15 patents and written for journals ACM and IEEE. He is expected to take over control of IBM from Ginni Rometty in April.



One of his employees says that he “has the ability to inspire create a sense of belonging and caring and communicating long term vision."

3. Satya Nadella - Microsoft

Satya Nadella claims the third spot as the Best CEO of 2021. This comes in the year when he was also appointed as the Chairman of Microsoft.

Forbes

Nadella became the CEO of Microsoft after Steve Balmer stepped down in 2014. Nadella’s employees describe him to be “really inspiring” while also saying that he “has a good vision and his global strategy is excellent."

Also Read: Indian CEOs That Took Over Silicon Valley In The US And Made India Proud

4. Eric Yuan - Zoom Video Communications

Another CEO that was among the top 5 was Zoom Video Communications’ Eric Yuan. His company rose to fame during the pandemic when video conferencing became the one way people and businesses could communicate and keep the ship afloat while the pandemic locked everyone indoors.

Reuters

Born in Tai'an Shandong Province China he completed a bachelor's degree in applied mathematics with a minor in computer application from Shandong University of Science and Technology as well as a master's degree in geology engineering from China University of Mining and Technology in Beijing. Yuan also completed a Stanford University executive program in 2006.



He worked at WebEx which was later acquired by Cisco and in 2011 he left the company to start Zoom.

Yuan’s employees claim that his “focus on happiness — for our customers and our employees — is infectious and permeates the organization from the top down."

6: Vladimir Shmunis - RingCentral

CEO Vladimir Shmunis and CTO Vlad Vendrow together founded RingCentral -- a cloud-based communications and collaboration solutions business. Originating from Ukraine and immigrating to the US in the 70s he later graduated from San Francisco State University with a master's degree in computer science.

via Comparably

He founded the enterprise software company Ring Zero Systems which he later sold to Motorola before starting RingCentral with Vendrow in 1999.



According to his employees he’s “a very down to earth person a great human being and a huge advocate for diversity and equity."

7: Henry Schuck - ZoomInfo

Seventh on the list is Henry Schuck CEO of ZoomInfo -- American subscription-based software as a service company based in Vancouver Washington. He completed his academics in the field of Law -- International Law from Oxford and Juris Doctorate Law from Ohio State University.

via Comparably

His employees reveal that he “works his tail off and leads by example which is all I need as an employee to stay motivated so we can collectively exceed our goals and win together."



9: Sundar Pichai - Google and Alphabet

Among the top 9 is Google and Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai. In fact he was only appointed to become the CEO of Alphabet in 2019 while he was made the CEO for Google in the year 2015.

Reuters

According to his employees he “gives a lot of benefits to his employees. It is a very fun and profound experience working at Google."



Also Read: Elon Musk Hails Indian Talent Shining In USA In Reaction To New Twitter CEO

10: Dan Rosensweig - Chegg

Tenth on the list is Dan Rosenweig who serves as the chairman president and chief executive officer of student services company Chegg. He’s previously been the CEO of Guitar Hero as well as COO at Yahoo!

via Comparably

One of Rosenweig’s employees says “I love Dan Rosensweig's passion for the education tech space. When he speaks at the all-hands he always manages to make me feel appreciated and proud to work for Chegg."



11: Sarah Friar - Nextdoor

The first female CEO to make it to this list Friar leads Nextdoor -- a social media platform to help neighbours connect. Hailing from Northern Ireland Friar was made CEO of a neighbourhood-focused social network platform in late 2018.

Reuters

Friar also serves on the boards of Walmart and messaging firm Slack. One of her employees says “I am proud to have a female CEO and appreciate Sarah's approach to her role.”



16: Archie Black - SPS Commerce

SPS Commerce is a cloud-based supply chain management software for retailers suppliers third-party logistics providers and partners. Archie Black was appointed as the CEO of the company in the year 1998. He has also holds board positions at Proto Labs University of St Thomas.

via Comparably

His employees laud his efforts in reducing systemic racism in the company “The goal of reducing systemic racism has been very apparent in our company through the last couple of years and I know our CEO is very passionate about it."



25: Tim Cook - Apple

Last on the top-25 list was Apple CEO Tim Cook who took control of the company after Steve Jobs left in 2011.

Reuters

His employees say that Cook is “Always looking for feedback on how to improve and often institute changes based upon feedback.”



Keep reading Indiatimes.com for the latest science and technology news.

Name: PTC
Name_1: PTC reaches Naugatuck valley | Metro Report International
Text_1:
Show Fullscreen

USA: Working with Connecticut Department of Transportation Metro-North Railroad has completed the installation of signalling and Positive Train Control on the Waterbury Branch.

The single-track line had been the last section of MNCR still relying on manual block operation and its resignalling completes the roll-out of the train protection system across the three-state network.

Dating from 1849 the historic Naugatuck Railroad has been worked by Metro-North since 1983 and the line was subsequently purchased by the state of Connecticut. It had been exempted from PTC implementation because it did not have any signalling. Train movements were authorised by a Rail Traffic Controller at Metro-North’s Operations Control Centre. However the department and operator decided to install CTC and PTC to improve safety and operational flexibility.

Work on the project began in April 2019 funded by CTDOT from state and federal contributions. CTC installation was completed in November enabling the PTC to be activated from November 20. The track has been upgraded to enable trains to operate at up to 75 km/h. New passing loops have been installed at Derby Beacon Falls and just south of Waterbury with a fourth planned at Devon.

Making use of the new signalling and loops CTDOT is looking to introduce a ‘two-way rail service’ on the branch in the coming months envisaging up to 22 trains each weekday from the summer of 2022.

‘Simply put PTC and signalisation mean better safety and better service’ explained Joseph Giulietti Commissioner of the Connecticut Department of Transportation. ‘Metro-North has been an essential partner in advancing the Waterbury Branch into the future and helping lay the groundwork for expanded train service. We thank them for playing an important part in helping us move Connecticut forward.’

‘The successful installation of the new signal system on the Waterbury Branch allowed us to bring the final segment of Metro-North online for PTC increasing passenger safety while also giving us the ability to provide more service on the branch in the future’ added MNCR President Catherine Rinaldi. ‘I am excited for our Connecticut customers to reap the benefits of a smoother commuting experience.’
Name_2: PIA gets first Airbus A-320 simulator
Text_2:
KARACHI: The national flag carrier Pakistan International Airlines (PIA) has acquired the first Airbus A320 simulator for the training of pilots refresher courses and air safety ARY News reported on Saturday.

The state-of-the-art Reality 7E Evolution Airbus A320 Full Flight Simulator (FFS) was acquired from L3Harris Technologies that will be installed at PIA Training Centre (PTC) in Karachi.

Pakistan will become the first country in the region that has acquired an A320 simulator for pilots’ training and air safety. It is pertinent to mention here that Pakistan has 670 pilots of Airbus A320.

Before acquiring the modern simulators the pilots were bound to travel abroad for refresher courses along with an inspector of civil aviation.

The installation of the Airbus simulator will end the huge expenditure of the national flag carrier for pilots’ training. It was learnt that pilots’ training was conducted at the cost of almost $300 per hour in the foreign countries excluding the travel and accommodation spendings.

The national airline has started the construction of a simulator complex in which the simulators of Boeing 747 777 and Airbus 320 will be installed. The simulator complex will be linked to the airport hotel.
Name_3: Karan Johar and Sidharth Malhotra welcomes Disha Patani and Raashi Khanna on board of 'Yodha'
Text_3:
Karan Johar and Sidharth Malhotra welcomes Disha Patani and Raashi Khanna on board of 'Yodha'

Karan Johar’s upcoming action film Yodha Sidharth Malhotra in the main lead and not Disha Patani and Raashi Khanna have joined his as well. The action film is being produced by Karan Johar who recently welcomed new cast members on board to the film project.

Image Source- Google

Two new posters of the film have been revealed while introducing the new cast. Sidharth Malhotra while sharing the posters wrote “Excited to have the two stunning female leads of #Yodha! onboard Disha Patani & Raashii Khanna. Get Ready we are coming to theatres near you on 11th November 2022.”

The leads to be onboard also expressed their joy where Disha wrote “Super glad to join this action-packed journey! I’m ready for take-off guys let’s go!”

On the other hand Raashii wrote “I am extremely honored & excited to announce that I will be joining team #Yodha!”

View this post on Instagram A post shared by Sidharth Malhotra (@sidmalhotra)

The film’s shoot began a month back and Sidharth has been occupied in that. The film has been directed by Pushkar Ojha and Sagar Ambre while it has been made the production banner of Dharma Productions and Mentor Disciple Film.

Image Source- Google

ALSO READ: Guru Randhawa shares the poster of his forthcoming song with Nora titled Dance Meri Rani

A few weeks back the first look of the planned franchise was unveiled. Sidharth Malhotra and Karan Johar share a strong bond as the actor made his debut with Karan’s film Student of the Year. After that the two again collaborated for the film ‘Shershaah’ which went on to become a super hit film. This is going to be the third time that Karan and Sidharth are collaborating and hopefully ‘Yodha’ will become another successful project of the two.

Name_2: Area shut down after military-grade ammo equipment found in Rockwall storage unit
Text_2:
The new owner of a storage unit in Rockwall made a surprise discovery that prompted police to shut down a roadway near a shopping center Friday night.

Rockwall police said military-grade munitions and equipment were found inside the newly-purchased storage unit at The Vault Storage off East Ralph Hall Parkway.

Authorities said any items that posed a threat to public safety were removed or destroyed.

A couple bought the storage unit up for $3000.

They said they usually go after collectible units but in this case they knew they had to call police.

Justin Grimes and his wife Jeana have been buying up storage units for a few years but this unit was different.

"This is probably the most extreme intense unit that we have found" Grimes said. "It’s better safe than sorry."

Friday afternoon the Grimes uncovered military grade munition and weaponry inside.

The couple said the previous owner an elderly man stopped paying rent so they purchased the locker for $3000.

Grimes who served in the Marine Corps himself said he had a suspicion when he saw some inventory photos online.

"I knew what was in there. I called the police to come verify what I think I already knew" he said. "I still don’t know what all they took."

Rockwall police won’t disclose all of the possible military inventory.

"Our first concern is the safety of the public" said Rockwall PD Lt. Aaron McGrew.

McGrew confirmed they called in the Garland Bomb Squad the United States Air Force and the FBI to set up a perimeter Friday night.

Ralph Hall Parkway was shut down and nearby businesses were evacuated.

"There was one device that was unstable and needed to be made safe and they took it into a field directly behind" McGrew said.

The Grimes documented the overnight investigation on their YouTube channel Grimes Finds.

Once federal agents cleared out early Saturday morning they started to sift through what was left.

There are several boxes they haven’t even had time to go through before they head straight to auction.

"I really love what I do and so I was up on these barrels with tank rounds around it because I wanted to get a baseball card. It could be a million-dollar baseball card in there" Grimes added.

Rockwall police said they handed the investigation over to the FBI to decided exactly where the weapons came from and whether these weapons were legal to own.

Name_4: Controversial Lake Elsinore hydroelectric project blocked by federal government
Text_4:
The Federal Energy Regulatory Commission has blocked a controversial $2 billion hydroelectric plant near the Lake Elsinore shoreline after the developer failed to provide requested environmental studies and a construction plan among other things.

Vista-based Nevada Hydro Co. has proposed building a 200-foot-high dam above the lake and a 500-megawatt underground power plant with turbines on 845 acres of U.S. Forest Service. Water would be pumped from the lake to a man-made reservoir when demand for electricity is low with water flowing back to the lake when demand is high. The project has been named the Lake Elsinore Advanced Pumped Storage Project or LEAPS.

This rendition from LEAPS developer Nevada Hydro purports to show a view of the Lake Elsinore Advance Pumped Storage Project from Lake Elsinore’s Eastern Shore.

An aerial view of Lake Elsinore looking south in 2005. Developer Nevada Hydro is proposing a hydroelectric project near the lake that would be called the Lake Elsinore Advanced Pumped Storage Project or LEAPS. (File photo by David Bauman The Press-Enterprise/SCNG)

A company is proposing to build a hydroelectric power project on Lake Elsinore’s west side seen in this photo.

The city of Lake Elsinore Riverside County the Pechanga Band of Luiseno Indians environmentalists and local residents oppose the project.

In a letter dated Dec. 9 FERC’s director of hydropower licensing Vince Yearick informed Nevada Hydro’s president that the commission was dismissing its project application because Nevada Hydro failed to provide the Forest Service with recreation groundwater seismic and geotechnical studies as well as a construction plan.

“The Forest Service states that while it has held multiple meetings with Nevada Hydro to seek resolution and completion of the required studies Nevada Hydro has informed the Forest Service that it does not intend to perform the studies and provide the remaining information prior to the Commission’s issuance of any license for the project” Yearick said in the letter.

Rejected again

On Dec. 13 the commission rejected Nevada Hydro’s Dec. 10 request for a preliminary permit that would give the company up to four years to conduct a project feasibility study. Nevada Hydro however could request a rehearing on the matter within 30 days said FERC spokeswoman Celeste Miller.

It was unclear what Nevada Hydro’s plans are moving forward. Company representatives including President Rexford Wait declined to comment.

New energy source

Nevada Hydro has also proposed installing 32 miles of transmission lines and 170 high-voltage steel towers that would carry electricity from Lake Elsinore to the unincorporated communities of La Cresta Tenaja Lakeland Village and Temescal Valley and then connect to power lines owned by Southern California Edison and San Diego Gas and Electric.

Nevada Hydro founded in 1997 said the project would give the region a reliable energy source and support 600 construction jobs and 20 to 30 permanent jobs. According to its website LEAPS was designed to respond to the growing need for reliable renewable electricity and to help meet California’s ambitious emissions reduction programs.

Welcome news

The federal government’s latest actions were welcome news to LEAPS opponents.

“Since this project is no longer formally in our program of work which serves to identify and prioritize current forest projects we will be able to shift our focus and put more energy into improving our recreational facilities and reducing hazardous fuels to reduce the risk to communities from catastrophic wildfire” said Freddie Duncan acting Trabuco District ranger of the Cleveland National Forest.

The Pechanga Band of Luiseno Indians spoke out against the project last year claiming Lake Elsinore as sacred tribal lands that were part of the Luiseno Creation Account and that events tied to the tribe’s religion and cosmology occurred there.

“We are pleased with this (project application) dismissal” Pechanga Chairman Mark Macarro said in a statement Friday Dec. 17. “There’s a reason Nevada Hydro has continuously failed to provide the necessary information for a thorough review: this is a hazardous incompatible and infeasible project for the wrong location. It’s time they move on.”

Problematic history

Nevada Hydro has been trying to get its LEAPS project off the ground for 17 years. It submitted its first application to the commission in February 2004. The history of the LEAPS project and the rocky relationship between Nevada Hydro and FERC dates back to 2004 and has gone back and forth with the commission ever since.

In 2011 FERC in another rejection letter to Nevada Hydro cited conflicts between the Elsinore Valley Municipal Water District and Nevada Hydro for denying its application. The commission also said Nevada Hydro and the commission had different goals had been unable to work together in the past and likely would be unable to collaborate if a license were issued.

Lake Elsinore reacts

On April 9 2019 the Lake Elsinore City Council unanimously voted to take a formal stance opposing the LEAPS project subject to conditions Deputy City Manager Nicole Dailey said in an email.

Among the community’s myriad concerns with the project are its potential adverse impacts on lake water quality lake levels the fishery and the shoreline. Other concerns Dailey said include the potential for disasters should the proposed dam breach fire hazards from the proposed 32-mile segment of high powered transmission lines the impact on wildlife the overall impact to the aesthetics of the community and the lake and the potential for property damage and acquisitions.

“The City Council has urged Nevada Hydro the project proponent to give serious consideration to these concerns and to provide additional project details including actual and measurable public benefits” Dailey said. “Unfortunately despite the passage of more than two years community concerns have not been addressed and the benefits of the project to the public remain elusive while the project impacts could be considerable.”

She said the commission acted appropriately in dismissing Nevada Hydro’s application.

“The U.S. Forest Service required Nevada Hydro to conduct additional studies in the Cleveland National Forest” Dailey said in an email. “Nevada Hydro refused to perform the studies and it appears from the dismissal gave the commission no choice but to dismiss the application based on their policy.”

Name: PulteGroup
Name_1: DiVosta announces new Naples community of 685 homes called Terreno
Text_1:
Gravina Smith Matte & Arnold

Special to Naples Daily News

PulteGroup one of the nation’s most recognized and trusted brands in homebuilding for 70 years has closed on the land for a new DiVosta-branded amenity-rich Naples community called Terreno.

DiVosta has announced a 320-acre parcel in northeast Naples where 685 new-construction single-family homes will be built. Pricing is expected from the upper $300s to $1 million and Terreno will offer a variety of one- and two-story home designs across three different series of homesite sizes. Model homes are expected to break ground in spring 2022 with sales beginning early fall 2022.

“We’re excited to be able to continue to meet the demand for new-homes in Naples by unveiling our newest floor plan designs coupled with an exciting offering of resort-inspired amenities and recreation spaces to fit any lifestyle” said Richard McCormick area president of PulteGroup’s Florida Divisions. “DiVosta is known to represent quality construction and an incredible resort lifestyle and Terreno is sure to exceed those expectations.”

The new gated community will feature two entrances a grand main entry off Oil Well Road with a secondary resident entry located off Randall Boulevard. Both entrance roadways connect directly to Immokalee Road.

The community site plan was designed to take advantage of the views offered by both the natural on-site preserve areas as well as the six holes at Valencia Golf & Country Club that run along the border of Terreno. Buyers will have the option to choose homesites with rare golf-course views as well as homesites with water views or located on cul-de-sacs.

The amenity center at Terreno will be centrally located within the community and easily accessed from both entrances to the community. Amenity offerings will include a state-of-the-art clubhouse with fitness center and community rooms courts for pickleball tennis and bocce ball a resort-inspired pool and large pool deck for lounging and a bar and restaurant adjacent to the pool.

Terreno’s location in northeast Naples will provide residents with convenient access to shopping dining recreation healthcare providers beautiful Gulf beaches and I-75 all of which can be accessed via Immokalee Road. The new community will also offer residents proximity to major local employers including Arthrex and NCH Healthcare System. A-rated elementary middle and high schools are located within one mile of Terreno.

North Collier Regional Park is less than three miles from Terreno and offers activities for the entire family including eight soccer fields five softball fields a fitness center shaded playground miles of walking trails and the Sun-N-Fun Lagoon water park. The new 150-acre Big Corkscrew Island Regional Park is also located just a few miles away featuring a playground community center sports fields and courts walking trails pavilions with concessions swimming pool amphitheater and large lawn where movies will be presented.

For exclusive monthly updates as the community progresses join the VIP Interest List for Terreno by visiting www.DiVosta.com/Terreno.

About DiVosta Homes

DiVosta Homes is a brand of PulteGroup Inc. (NYSE: PHM). DiVosta Homes builds consumer inspired homes and communities that provide casual resort-style living for those wanting a winter retreat or a home year-round in its home state of Florida. In addition to providing the sunny Florida lifestyle DiVosta Homes has always stood for renowned quality for over 50 years. For more information on DiVosta visit www.divosta.com.

About PulteGroup

PulteGroup Inc. (NYSE: PHM) based in Atlanta Georgia is one of America’s largest homebuilding companies with operations in more than 40 markets throughout the country. Through its brand portfolio that includes Centex Pulte Homes Del Webb DiVosta Homes John Wieland Homes and Neighborhoods and American West the company is one of the industry’s most versatile homebuilders able to meet the needs of multiple buyer groups and respond to changing consumer demand. PulteGroup conducts extensive research to provide homebuyers with innovative solutions and consumer inspired homes and communities to make lives better.

For more information about PulteGroup Inc. and PulteGroup brands go to pultegroup.com; www.pulte.com; www.centex.com; www.delwebb.com; www.divosta.com; www.jwhomes.com; and www.americanwesthomes.com. Follow PulteGroup Inc. on Twitter: @PulteGroupNews.

Name: Qualcomm
Name_1: Qualcomm is working on the Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 already
Text_1:
Qualcomm has just released the Snapdragon 8 Gen 1 processor as its latest flagship processor with a re-worked name to boot. Now a Weibo-based chip industry leaker asserts that the OEM is working on its successor already. This possibly accelerated timeline might be related to MediaTek's rising status in the same field.

4 Reviews

Smartphone OEMs are reportedly falling over themselves to get their new Snapdragon 8 Gen 1-powered flagships on the market early. Unfortunately for them there are rumors that this top-end processor's successor is already in the works.

The tipster Mobile Chip Masters asserts that this is the case and that Qualcomm aims to ship it as early as May 2022. According to the leaker the OEM has done so in order to secure valuable time on the 4nm manufacturing node run by TSMC which has apparently been engaged to produce the "8 Gen 2" in volumes even greater than those of either the Gen 1 or MediaTek's competing Dimensity 9000.

On that note the "threat" posed by the 9000 is framed as Qualcomm's motivation in this leak: apparently this plan would make the OEM TSMC's 2nd biggest customer pushing MediaTek down to approximately 4th. Then again the "Gen 2" referred to in this post could in fact be the 'second wave' of the Gen 1 said to have been ported to TSMC's process from that of Samsung in an earlier leak.

Buy a Motorola Edge (2021) on Amazon
Name_2: Apple will also develop Wi-Fi Bluetooth and RF chips by itself
Text_2:
Apple is hiring wireless chip engineers in Irvine California. Top chip manufacturers like Broadcom and Skyworks also have offices in this region. According to reports Apple is hiring these engineers for chip development that may involve RF Bluetooth and Wi-Fi chips. Bloomberg speculates that Apple plans to develop its own RF Bluetooth and Wi-Fi chips to replace Broadcom Skyworks and Qualcomm’s related components.

An Apple spokesperson declined to comment on the recruitment plan. However after the report Skyworks shares plunged 11% Broadcom and Qualcomm both fell more than 4%. Apple is the big beneficiary of many chip manufacturers. Bloomberg data shows that Apple-related revenue accounts for 60% of Skyworks’ revenue. For Broadcom 20% of its revenue comes from Apple-related businesses. The $15 billion wireless component supply agreement reached by Broadcom and Apple in early 2020 will expire in 2023.

Gizchina News of the week Join GizChina on Telegram

There is also the British GPU designer Imagination Technologies. Apple’s decision to start self-developed GPUs in 2017 almost bankrupted Imagination Technologies. It was not until 2020 that the two parties reached a new license agreement. This is not the first time Apple has entered the field of wireless chips.

Apple has made custom parts on AirPods and Apple Watch before. Apple also uses a U1 UWB ultra-wideband chip on a large scale since iPhone 11. This chip is for near-field precise positioning. Apple has also released Bluetooth and UWB technology for AirTag “anti-lost device”.

Apple is devouring everything upstream and downstream.

The main reason why Apple’s job information will involve Broadcom and Skyworks is the place of Irving and Apple’s historical habits. In addition to the offices of Broadcom and Skyworks in Irvine NXP is also here (Apple mobile payment uses NXP’s NFC chip). Also the University of California Irvine which is famous for radio frequency-related engineering projects is also here.

Apple has the habit of setting up offices near suppliers and sometimes this is the first step in Apple’s replacement. In the past Apple set up a chip office in Portland Oregon near the Intel building in Austin Texas and Orlando Florida (AMD) in Haifa and Herzliya Israel (with Intel engineers) and in Germany (near Infineon’s headquarters in Munich).

In addition Apple invested in a power management chip company Dialog Semiconductor Plc in 2018 and took over hundreds of employees in the UK and Italy. Apple is still expanding everywhere. Its headquarters is in Cupertino but it also has many employees in San Diego (where Qualcomm is headquartered). It has expanded its recruitment to chips smart homes displays and software.

Apple a behemoth with a market value of nearly $3 trillion is devouring everything upstream and downstream.
Name_3: MediaTek Dimensity 9000 may have a faster CPU than the Snapdragon 8 Gen 1
Text_3:
The MediaTek Dimensity 9000 was recently touted to offer better AI performance than the Snapdragon 888 chip. The leaked AI benchmarks also revealed that the latest flagship MediaTek chip might be capable of surpassing Qualcomm’s Snapdragon 8 Gen 1 SoC. Now a new leak reveals that the MediaTek Dimensity 9000 might be faster than Qualcomm’s new flagship chip.

A leaked video on Weibo showed a smartphone running the MediaTek Dimensity 9000 on AnTuTu and Geekbench. Starting with AnTuTu MediaTek managed to surpass the one million mark with a score of 1017488 points. We know from previous leaks that the Snapdragon 8 Gen 1 also surpassed one million points on AnTuTu.

Story continues below Advertisement Remove Ad

Moving on to Geekbench and the MediaTek Dimensity 9000 record a single-core score of 1273 points and a multi-core score of 4324 points. We have already seen the Snapdragon 8 Gen 1 version of the Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra manage a nearly identical single core score of 1219 points although the Snapdragon chip is yet to cross the 4000 mark in Geekbench’s multi-core test.

And while the Dimensity 9000 chip is looking faster than the Snapdragon 8 Gen 1 the GPU test on GFXBenc v3.0 Manhattan saw MediaTek’s flagship chip score 238fps. The Snapdragon chip was up ahead with 267fps. It was the same story in the Aztec test where the Dimensity 9000 did 43fps while the Snapdragon managed 49fps.

The Dimensity 9000 also got 17573 in PCMark and 1024 in ETHZ AI Benchmark (v5). You can check out the full video here. It is worth noting that the benchmarks don’t account for sustained performance but from the looks of things MediaTek may just leap frog Qualcomm in terms of performance.

Also Read: MediaTek increases its lead in smartphone SoC shipments Qualcomm dominates 5G: Counterpoint

Oppo Find X4 Redmi K50 series will use 4nm MediaTek Dimensity 9000
Name_4: EV owners gear up for possible legal action against Great Wall Motor
Text_4:
Chinese electric vehicle company Ora is facing mounting consumer backlash and potential legal action after it installed an old computer chip in one of its car models -- despite telling buyers it came with a cutting-edge one worth around twice the price.

Buyers of the Ora Good Cat which has a starting price of around 100000 yuan ($15700) say when they complained they were offered a package of store credit including subsidized charging free software updates and app memberships.
Name_5: Vivo Y32 launched as the world's first Snapdragon 680 powered smartphone key details here
Text_5:
Vivo has launched a new Y-series smartphone the Vivo Y32 it is the world’s first smartphone to be powered by Qualcomm’s Snapdragon 680 processor. It comes with a 6.51-inch display a dual rear camera setup and a 5000 mAh battery that supports fast charging.

Vivo Y32 is a dual-sim phone that runs on the company’s OriginOS 1.0 based on Android 11. It was launched in China with a 6.51 inch HD+ display that has a resolution of 720 x 1600 pixels and an aspect ratio of 20:9. The display has a 1500:1 contrast ratio an 89 percent screen-to-body ratio and a standard refresh rate of 60 Hz.

advertisement

The handset carries an octa-core Qualcomm Snapdragon 680 chipset coupled with 8 GB LPDDR4x RAM that can be expanded virtually up to 12 GB along with 128 GB of internal storage capacity.

It costs CYN 1399 (approx. Rs 16700) and is available in a variety of colours options including Foggy Night and Harumi Blue. However no information on the phone’s release date or availability outside of China has been shared.

Coming to the camera department of the smartphone the Vivo Y32 features a dual rear camera setup that consists of a 13 megapixel primary sensor with an f/2.2 lens and a 2 megapixel secondary sensor with an f/2.4 lens. The handset also comes with an 8 megapixel selfie camera in the front with an f/1.8 lens.

For connectivity The smartphone comes with dual-SIM 4G dual-band WiFi Bluetooth 5.0 GNSS (GPS BeiDou GLONASS GALILEO QZSS) a USB Type-C port and a 3.5mm headphone jack.

It has all the essential sensors like an accelerometer ambient light sensor compass proximity sensor and a side-mounted fingerprint sensor.

It has a large 5000 mAh battery with support for 18W fast charging. The smartphone is designed to provide up to 27 days of standby time or over 18 hours of talk time on a single charge. The dimensions of the smartphone are 164.26  76.08 x 8mm and it has a weight of 182 grams.

In related news Vivo is expected to launch the V23 mid range smartphone soon. While details are scarce regarding the V23 and the V23 Pro according to rumours the V23 Pro will go on sale first followed by the V23 in the first half of January. However Vivo has not revealed any information regarding the V23 series yet.
